hanzi-su-wiki:
閑

Значения

Свободное время, досуг; тихий, спокойный; пустой, незанятый, свободный

Мнемоника

Заброшенный дом, в воротах 門 которого выросло дерево 木.

Варианты

闲, 閒
purpleculture_pinyin:
xián
enclosure; (variant of 闲 ) idle; unoccupied; leisure
ограждение; (вариант 闲) холостой ход; незанятые; досуг
rtega_mnemonic:
閑閑RS
闲闲		fence, barrier, defend, idle time
  • RS. a fence with a gate 門 made of wood 木
  • wooden 木 structure blocking the gate 門: family on idle time (vacation)
  • tree 木 visible from the gate 門: you are on vacation (leisure)
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 闲)
Antonyms: 忙
Ideographic: A wooden fence 木 with a door 門
purpleculture_examples:
閑話 [ xián huà ]: variant of 闲话 ; digression; gossip; complaint; scandal; Classifiers: 段
閒話 [ xián huà ]: casual conversation; chat; gossip; to talk about (whatever comes to mind)
閒置 [ xián zhì ]: to leave sth unused; to lie idle
閒談 [ xián tán ]: to chat
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿵ Surround from above
    • 門 [ mén ] gate, door, entrance, opening
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
koohiiStory1: Imagine the gates the Garden of Eden, the ultimate land of leisure. You´re not allowed in, but if you peek through you can see trees.
koohiiStory2: Imagine Leisure Suit Larry walking through the saloon doors with wood in his pants, hoping to get lucky.
jp_example_words: 長閑(のどか): tranquil, calm, quiet
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You see a gate with a tree growing through it and it reminds you that you need more leisure time. You walk up to the gate tree and curl up under its branches. No one will bother you because the tree is blocking the gate from being used.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine spending your leisure time curled up under a tree that's growing through a gate. It's so cozy and secluded!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: As you leisurely nap, you hear a gruff voice, "Ah, you're done too, huh?" It's Genghis Khan (かん)! He's spending his leisure time relaxing under this abandoned gate just like you.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: But wait. Isn't Genghis Khan dead now? He winks at you, "Leisure time is for the dead." He smiles, and fades away, disappearing into the tree.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the tree (木) under the gate (門) is at leisure
humanum_short_description_en:
The inscriptions from the " door " to the " wood ", like the door in the shape of wood, some people think it means to cover the fence (see Xu Shen, Zhang Shichao, etc.). "Said Wen": "Xiang, Lan Ye. There is wood in the door."

The inscription means intermittent, rest, and the same: "The grandson and the grandson are the father of (zuo) you (you) Wu (yu), and the mother (wu) daughter (ru) and (have) leisure (idle)." means It is said that grandsons from generation to generation have assisted Dafather Yu without intermission (see Chen Mengjia, Takada Tadashu).
humanum_short_description:
金文從「門」從「木」，象門中有木之形，有人認為表示遮欄之意(參許慎、張世超等)。《說文》：「閑，闌也。从門中有木。」

　　金文表示間歇、休止，同簋：「世孫孫子子差(佐)右(佑)吳(虞)大父，母(毋)女(汝)又(有)閑(閒)。」意思是說世代孫子都輔助虞大父，毋有間歇(參陳夢家、高田忠周)。

Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 忙
Ideographic: A wooden fence 木 with a door 門
  • ⿵ Surround from above
    • 門 [ mén ] gate, door, entrance, opening
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
①無事，與“忙”相對：閒暇。閒逛。閒居。閒人。居閒。空閒。
②指房屋、器物等放着不用：閒置。閒棄。閒房。閒錢。
③安靜，清靜：安閒。悠閒。閒逸。閒適。閒庭(清靜的院落)。閒情逸致。
④與正事無關的：閒談。閒聊。閒筆(指文學作品中與主題無關的文字)。
⑤平常：等閒。
⑥古同“嫺”，熟習，文雅。
⑦空虛：回首總成閒。
⑧木欄之類的遮攔物。
⑨防禦：防閒。

閑字的基本解释

閑
xián
见“闲”。

閑字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xián］
［《廣韻》户閒切，平山，匣。］
“闲1”的繁体字。同“閒4”。
(1)用于遮拦阻隔的栅栏。
(2)指马厩。
(3)防止；限制。
(4)捍卫，保卫。
(5)法度；界限。多指礼义道德规范。
(6)阻隔。
(7)闭。
(8)大貌。
(9)纠正；治理。
(10)同“閒”。

閑字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【門字部】　閑； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页1332第02
【唐韻】戸閒切【集韻】【韻會】何閒切【正韻】何艱切，?音閒。【說文】闌也。从門，中有木。【徐曰】閑，猶闌也。以木歫門也。會意。【廣韻】防也，禦也，法也。【易·乾卦】閑邪存其誠。【疏】言防閑邪惡，當自存其誠實也。又【家人】閑有家。【疏】正義曰：治家之道在初，卽須嚴正立法防閑也。又【書·畢命】雖收放心，閑之維艱。　又【廣韻】大也。【詩·商頌】旅楹有閑。【疏】?列其楹，有閑然而大。　又【詩·魏風】桑者閑閑兮。【傳】閑閑然，男女無別往來之貌。　又【爾雅·釋詁】習也。【詩·秦風】遊于北園，四馬旣閑。【傳】閑，習也。又【禮·經解】以之田獵有禮，故戎事閑也。　又【韻會】馬闌也。【前漢·百官公卿表】龍馬閑駒。【註】閑闌，養馬之所也。故曰閑駒。【周禮·夏官·校人】天子十有二閑。【註】每廐爲一閑。【左傳·成十八年註】每廐爲一閑，閑有二百一十六匹。　又【周禮·夏官·虎賁氏】舎則守王閑。【註】閑，梐枑。【疏】閑與梐枑，皆禁衞之物也。　又閡也。【易·大畜】日閑輿衞。【註

idle
xián

idle
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xián］
["Guangyun" household leisure cutting, Pingshan, Xie. ]
Traditional characters for "闲1". Same as "Free 4".
(1) Fences used to block and block.
(2) Refers to the stables.
(3) Prevent; restrict.
(4) Defend, defend.
(5) Laws; limits. Refers to the ethics of etiquette.
(6) Blocking.
(7) Closed.
(8) The big picture.
(9) Correction; governance.
(10) The same as "free".
idle

[Tang Yun] Xian cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] He Xian cut [Zheng Yun] How difficult is it to cut? Sound free. [Said the text] Lan also. From the door, there is wood in it. [Xu Yue] Leisure, still lingering. Yi Mu Xiaomen also. Knowing. [Guang Yun] Fang Ye, Yu Ye, Law Ye. [Yi·Qian Gua] Leisurely evils preserve their sincerity. 【Sparse】You should keep your honesty when you speak against the evil in idleness. And [family] have a home freely. [Shu] Zhengyi said: The way to govern the family is at the beginning, and it is necessary to strictly legislate to prevent leisure. Also [Book·Life] Although you can take it away and rest assured, it’s hard to take it easy.　[Guang Yun] Da Ye. 【Poetry·Commercial Song】Traveling in a leisurely life. 【Sparse】? List its yin, leisurely but big.　[Poetry·Wei Feng] The mulberry is idle. [Biography] Leisurely, the appearance of men and women in the same way.　[Erya·Shi Xie] Xi Ye. 【Poetry·Qin Feng】Swim in the North Park, four horses leisurely. [Biography] Xian, Xi Ye. Also 【Rite·Confucianism】It is courteous to hunt in the field, so it is also a leisure time.　[Rhyme Club] Ma Lan also. [Former Han · Baiguan Gongqing Form] Long Ma Xianju. [Note] Xianlan is also a place to raise horses. So called Xianju. 【Zhou Li·Xiaguan·Schoolman】The emperor has two leisures. [Note] Each page is a free time. 【Zuo Zhuan·Eighteen Years Note】Each piece is a leisure, and there are 216 horses in the leisure.　[Zhou Li·Xiaguan·Hu Ben's】Yuan Ze Shou Wang Xian. [Note] Leisure, 梐枑. idle
Name meaning
Nothing.
xián
вм. 闲
Radicals: 門, 木  (gate, tree)
Meaning Mnemonic
You see a gate with a tree growing through it and it reminds you that you need more leisure time. You walk up to the gate tree and curl up under its branches. No one will bother you because the tree is blocking the gate from being used.
Imagine spending your leisure time curled up under a tree that's growing through a gate. It's so cozy and secluded!
Reading Mnemonic
As you leisurely nap, you hear a gruff voice, "Ah, you're done too, huh?" It's Genghis Khan (かん)! He's spending his leisure time relaxing under this abandoned gate just like you.
But wait. Isn't Genghis Khan dead now? He winks at you, "Leisure time is for the dead." He smiles, and fades away, disappearing into the tree.
